snippet: Wednesday was a day for the chicken-sandwich culture wars, at least in Atlanta, where Chick-fil-A got its start in 1946.
abstract: Chick-fil-A franchises across the country are packed with conservative Christian customers expressing support for the company's stance against gay marriage and homosexuality; outpouring is part of an appreciation day organized by former Arkansas Gov Mike Huckabee in response to turmoil surrounding antigay comments by the company's president, Dan T Cathy.

byline.original: By KIM SEVERSON and ROBBIE BROWN

lead_paragraph: Wednesday was a day for the chicken-sandwich culture wars, at least in Atlanta, where Chick-fil-A got its start in 1946.

headline.main: A Day for Chicken Sandwiches as Proxy in a Cultural Debate
headline.print_headline: A Day for Chicken Sandwiches As Proxy in a Cultural Debate

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
